death_place.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军总医院

description.zh-cn: 中国话剧作家、戏曲作家、电影剧本作家、诗人、词作家，《义勇军进行曲》的词作者。文化大革命期间被迫害致死。
description.en: A Chinese playwright, opera writer, screenwriter, poet, and lyricist, best known for writing the lyrics of "March of the Volunteers". He was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的父亲。
description.en: Tian Han's father.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的母亲。
description.en: Tian Han's mother.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的弟弟。
description.en: Tian Han's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的弟弟。
description.en: Tian Han's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的第一任妻子，易象之女。
description.en: Tian Han's first wife, daughter of Yi Xiang.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的第二任妻子。
description.en: Tian Han's second wife.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的第三任妻子。
description.en: Tian Han's third wife.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的第四任妻子，中共特科成员。
description.en: Tian Han's fourth wife, a member of the CCP's special service.

description.zh-cn: 田汉与易漱瑜之子。
description.en: Son of Tian Han and Yi Shuyu.

description.zh-cn: 田汉与安娥之子。
description.en: Son of Tian Han and An E.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国时期的一场政治运动，期间田汉被迫害致死。
description.en: A political movement in the People's Republic of China during which Tian Han was persecuted to death.

description.zh-cn: 电影《风云儿女》的主题曲，由田汉作词，聂耳作曲。1949年被选为中华人民共和国代国歌，1982年正式成为国歌。
description.en: The theme song of the film "Children of Troubled Times", with lyrics by Tian Han and music by Nie Er. It was chosen as the provisional national anthem of the People's Republic of China in 1949 and officially became the national anthem in 1982.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代文学史上一个重要的文学社团，田汉是其成员。
description.en: An influential literary society in modern Chinese history, of which Tian Han was a member.

description.zh-cn: 位于湖南长沙的一所师范学校，田汉曾在此就读。
description.en: A normal school in Changsha, Hunan, where Tian Han studied.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家和教育家，曾任长沙师范学校校长。
description.en: Chinese revolutionary and educator, who served as the principal of Changsha Normal School.

description.zh-cn: 田汉的舅父，民国初年曾任湖南省政厅厅长。
description.en: Tian Han's maternal uncle, who served as the Director of the Political Affairs Department of Hunan Province in the early Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一所大学，田汉曾在此留学。
description.en: A university in Japan where Tian Han studied.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代文学家、历史学家、社会活动家，田汉的挚友。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer, historian, social activist, and a close friend of Tian Han.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物、历史学家，田汉的挚友。
description.en: A Chinese politician, historian, and a close friend of Tian Han.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代作家，田汉的挚友。
description.en: A modern Chinese writer and a close friend of Tian Han.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，曾任湖南省省长。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China who once served as the governor of Hunan province.

description.zh-cn: 中国的一家出版机构，田汉曾在此任编辑。
description.en: A publishing house in China where Tian Han worked as an editor.

description.zh-cn: 由田汉创办的艺术团体，分文学、绘画、音乐、戏剧、电影五部。
description.en: An art collective founded by Tian Han, with five departments: literature, painting, music, drama, and film.

description.zh-cn: 中国的政党，田汉曾短期在其总政治部宣传处工作。
description.en: A Chinese political party where Tian Han briefly worked in its General Political Department's propaganda section.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央特别行动科的简称，是中共早期的情报和政治保卫机关。
description.en: The special service agency of the early Communist Party of China, responsible for intelligence and political security.

description.zh-cn: 中国左翼作家联盟的简称，田汉于1930年加入。
description.en: The short name for the League of Left-Wing Writers, which Tian Han joined in 1930.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期主要领导人之一。
description.en: One of the early main leaders of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国音乐家，为《义勇军进行曲》谱曲。
description.en: A Chinese composer who wrote the music for "March of the Volunteers".

description.zh-cn: 一部中国电影，《义勇军进行曲》是其主题曲。
description.en: A Chinese film for which "March of the Volunteers" served as the theme song.

description.zh-cn: 1941年由田汉在桂林组建的剧社。
description.en: A drama society formed by Tian Han in Guilin in 1941.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家，通常简称为中国。
description.en: A country in East Asia, commonly known as China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会的机关报。
description.en: The official newspaper of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 田汉创作的京剧剧本，在文化大革命中被批判为“大毒草”。
description.en: A Peking opera script written by Tian Han, which was criticized as a "big poisonous weed" during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期的群众性学生组织。
description.en: A mass student-led paramilitary social movement during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军负责保卫首都北京的军事单位。
description.en: A military command of the People's Liberation Army responsible for the defense of the capital, Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国北京市昌平区的监狱，以关押高级别政治犯而闻名。
description.en: A maximum-security prison located in Changping District, Beijing, China, known for housing high-ranking political prisoners.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间设立的，用于审查高级干部的专门机构。
description.en: A special body established during the Cultural Revolution to investigate high-ranking officials.

nodes.id: 中国人民解放军总医院

zh-cn: 中国人民解放军总医院

description.zh-cn: 位于北京的著名医院，田汉在此逝世。
description.en: A renowned hospital in Beijing where Tian Han passed away.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命中被迫害致死。
description.en: Former Chairman of the People's Republic of China, who was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间对田汉、周扬、夏衍、阳翰笙四位文艺界人士的合称贬称。
description.en: A derogatory collective term used during the Cultural Revolution to refer to four literary and art figures: Tian Han, Zhou Yang, Xia Yan, and Yang Hansheng.

description.zh-cn: 中国文艺理论家、文学翻译家、政治人物，“四条汉子”之一。
description.en: A Chinese literary theorist, translator, and politician, one of the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 中国剧作家、社会活动家，“四条汉子”之一。
description.en: A Chinese playwright and social activist, one of the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 中国剧作家、小说家，“四条汉子”之一。
description.en: A Chinese playwright and novelist, one of the "Four Guys".

nodes.id: 第五届全国人民代表大会

zh-cn: 第五届全国人民代表大会

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家最高权力机关。
description.en: The highest state authority of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 田汉是田禹卿的儿子。
description.en: Tian Han is the son of Tian Yuqing.

description.zh-cn: 田汉是易克勤的儿子。
description.en: Tian Han is the son of Yi Keqin.

description.zh-cn: 田寿康是田汉的弟弟。
description.en: Tian Shoukang is Tian Han's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 田寿麟是田汉的弟弟。
description.en: Tian Shoulin is Tian Han's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 易漱瑜是田汉的第一任妻子。
description.en: Yi Shuyu was Tian Han's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 黄大琳是田汉的第二任妻子。
description.en: Huang Dalin was Tian Han's second wife.

description.zh-cn: 林维中是田汉的第三任妻子。
description.en: Lin Weizhong was Tian Han's third wife.

description.zh-cn: 安娥是田汉的第四任妻子。
description.en: An E was Tian Han's fourth wife.

description.zh-cn: 田申是田汉的儿子。
description.en: Tian Shen is Tian Han's son.

description.zh-cn: 田申是易漱瑜的儿子。
description.en: Tian Shen is Yi Shuyu's son.

description.zh-cn: 田大畏是田汉的儿子。
description.en: Tian Dawei is Tian Han's son.

description.zh-cn: 田大畏是安娥的儿子。
description.en: Tian Dawei is An E's son.

description.zh-cn: 易漱瑜是易象的女儿。
description.en: Yi Shuyu is the daughter of Yi Xiang.

description.zh-cn: 1912年入读长沙师范学校。
description.en: Enrolled in Changsha Normal School in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 1916年赴日，入东京高等师范学校（后来的东京教育大学）学习。
description.en: Went to Japan in 1916 and studied at Tokyo Higher Normal School (later Tokyo University of Education).

description.zh-cn: 田汉在长沙师范学校就读时，校长是徐特立。
description.en: When Tian Han studied at Changsha Normal School, Xu Teli was the principal.

description.zh-cn: 田汉在日本留学期间与郭沫若结为挚友。
description.en: Tian Han became close friends with Guo Moruo while studying in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 田汉在日本留学期间与左舜生结为挚友。
description.en: Tian Han became close friends with Zuo Shunsheng while studying in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 田汉在日本留学期间与张资平结为挚友。
description.en: Tian Han became close friends with Zhang Ziping while studying in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 1920年12月，易象在长沙被赵恒惕杀害。
description.en: In December 1920, Yi Xiang was killed by Zhao Hengti in Changsha.

description.zh-cn: 1920年代，田汉是亲共作家组织创造社的成员。
description.en: In the 1920s, Tian Han was a member of the Creation Society, a pro-communist writers' organization.

description.zh-cn: 1922年起，田汉在上海中华书局任编辑。
description.en: Starting in 1922, Tian Han worked as an editor at the Zhonghua Book Company in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 1925年，田汉创办“南国社”。
description.en: In 1925, Tian Han founded the "Nanguo She" (South China Society).

position.en: Staff at the General Political Department's Propaganda Section

description.zh-cn: 1927年四一二事变之后，曾短期在中国国民党总政治部宣传处工作，负责电影戏剧事务。
description.en: After the Shanghai massacre of 1927, he briefly worked in the propaganda section of the Kuomintang's General Political Department, in charge of film and drama affairs.

description.zh-cn: 安娥是上海中共特科成员。
description.en: An E was a member of the CCP's special service in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 在安娥影响下，田汉加入了“左联”，并申请入共产党。
description.en: Under the influence of An E, Tian Han joined the "League of Left-Wing Writers" and applied to join the Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 1930年，在安娥影响下，田汉加入了“左联”。
description.en: In 1930, under the influence of An E, Tian Han joined the "League of Left-Wing Writers".

description.zh-cn: 1932年一二八事变后，田汉经瞿秋白主持加入中国共产党。
description.en: After the January 28 incident of 1932, Tian Han joined the Communist Party of China with Qu Qiubai presiding over his admission.

description.zh-cn: 1932年加入中国共产党。1975年被死后“永远开除党籍”，1979年平反并恢复党籍。
description.en: Joined the Communist Party of China in 1932. He was posthumously "permanently expelled from the party" in 1975, and was rehabilitated and had his membership restored in 1979.

description.zh-cn: 为电影《风云儿女》创作了主题曲的歌词，即《义勇军进行曲》。
description.en: Wrote the lyrics for the theme song of the film "Children of Troubled Times", which is the "March of the Volunteers".

description.zh-cn: 为田汉作词的《义勇军进行曲》谱曲。
description.en: Composed the music for "March of the Volunteers", with lyrics by Tian Han.

description.zh-cn: 1941年在大后方桂林组建新中国剧社。
description.en: In 1941, he formed the New China Drama Society in Guilin.

description.zh-cn: 1949年建国前夕，《义勇军进行曲》被选为中华人民共和国国歌。
description.en: On the eve of the founding of the PRC in 1949, "March of the Volunteers" was selected as the national anthem.

description.zh-cn: 刊登批判文章，称田汉的《谢瑶环》是“大毒草”，开启了对田汉的公开批判。
description.en: Published critical articles calling Tian Han's "Xie Yaohuan" a "big poisonous weed", initiating public criticism against him.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命中，田汉遭到批斗、监禁和非人虐待，最终于1968年被迫害致死。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Tian Han was subjected to public criticism sessions, imprisonment, and inhuman abuse, ultimately leading to his death from persecution in 1968.

description.zh-cn: 1966年7月，田汉被红卫兵批斗。
description.en: In July 1966, Tian Han was subjected to struggle sessions by the Red Guards.

description.zh-cn: 1966年12月4日，田汉被北京卫戍区司令部监押。
description.en: On December 4, 1966, Tian Han was arrested and imprisoned by the Beijing Garrison Command.

description.zh-cn: 田汉被关押于秦城监狱后，中央专案组成立田汉专案组继续审讯。
description.en: After Tian Han was imprisoned in Qincheng Prison, the Central Case Examination Group formed a special task force to continue his interrogation.

description.zh-cn: 1970年，中国大陆大规模批斗“四条汉子”（田汉、周扬、夏衍、阳翰笙）。
description.en: In 1970, a large-scale campaign of criticism was launched against the "Four Guys" (Tian Han, Zhou Yang, Xia Yan, Yang Hansheng) in mainland China.

description.zh-cn: 田汉是被称为“四条汉子”的四位文艺界人士之一。
description.en: Tian Han was one of the four literary and art figures known as the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 周扬是被称为“四条汉子”的四位文艺界人士之一。
description.en: Zhou Yang was one of the four literary and art figures known as the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 夏衍是被称为“四条汉子”的四位文艺界人士之一。
description.en: Xia Yan was one of the four literary and art figures known as the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 阳翰笙是被称为“四条汉子”的四位文艺界人士之一。
description.en: Yang Hansheng was one of the four literary and art figures known as the "Four Guys".

description.zh-cn: 1979年4月，中共为田汉平反，恢复其党籍和名誉。
description.en: In April 1979, the CCP posthumously rehabilitated Tian Han, restoring his party membership and reputation.

relationships.source: 第五届全国人民代表大会

description.zh-cn: 1982年，第五届全国人民代表大会第五次会议通过决议，恢复田汉作词的《义勇军进行曲》为国歌。
description.en: In 1982, the Fifth Session of the 5th National People's Congress passed a resolution to restore "March of the Volunteers" with Tian Han's original lyrics as the national anthem.
